label: prostate cancer, hereditary
definition: An instance of prostate cancer that is caused by an inherited genomic modification in an individual. Familial prostate cancer (FPC) is a malignant tumor of the prostate with an early onset. FPC is either asymptomatic or causes mictionary symptoms, erectile dysfunction, bone pain, venous compression and infectious or inflammatory syndrome (for the metastatic forms). It is also characterized by familial antecedents.

label: verruga peruana
definition: A rare bacterial infectious disease characterized by development of endothelial cell-derived, blood-filled tumors on the surface of the skin during the chronic phase of infection with Bartonella bacilliformis. The lesions can persist for months to years and may cause pain and scarring due to ulceration. They are classified as miliary (multiple red papules of <3 mm in diameter), mular (blood-filled nodules), and diffuse (groups of subdermal nodules >5 mm in diameter). Eruptions may be accompanied by fever and malaise, lymphadenopathy, acute bone and joint pains, and headache. Fatality rates during this phase are low.

label: developmental delay-language impairment-dopa responsive dystonia-parkinsonism syndrome due to a NR4A2 point mutation
definition: An intellectual developmental disorder with language impairment and early-onset DOPA-responsive dystonia-parkinsonism in which the cause of the disease is a point mutation in the gene NR4A2.

label: autosomal dominant dopa-responsive dystonia
definition: A rare neurometabolic disorder characterized by childhood-onset dystonia that shows a dramatic and sustained response to low doses of levodopa (L-dopa) and that may be associated with parkinsonism at an older age.

label: megaloblastic anemia-immunodeficiency due to folate transporter 1 deficiency
Phelan-McDermid syndrome due to SHANK3 mutation
cardiac anomalies-short stature-joint hypermobility-facial dysmorphism syndrome due to TAB2 mutation
common arterial trunk with aortic dominance
common arterial trunk with pulmonary dominance and interrupted aortic arch
pilocytic astrocytoma with histological features of anaplasia
bilateral diffuse uveal melanocytic proliferation disease
severe congenital myelofibrosis-pancytopenia-intellectual disability-neurologic and ophthalmic abnormalities syndrome
progressive hypotonia-intellectual disability-facial dysmorphism syndrome due to FYVE-defective RBSN
well-differentiated papillary mesothelial tumour of the pleura
neuronopathy, distal hereditary motor, autosomal recessive 11, with spasticity
neurodevelopmental disorder with hypotonia, brain anomalies, distinctive facies, and absent language
hyperphagia leading to hepatic steatosis, pig
definition: Hereditary increased feed intake leading to fatty liver in pigs due to a variation in the MC4R gene.

label: dilated cardiomyopathy PLN-related, dog
definition: Any dilated cardiomyopathy in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the PLN gene.

label: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, SGCD-related, golden hamster
definition: Any hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in golden hamsters in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the SGCD gene.

label: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, SGCD-related, pig
definition: Any hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in pigs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the SGCD gene.

label: congenital dyshormonogenic hypothyroidism with goiter, SLC5A5-related, dog
definition: Any congenital hypothyroidism in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the SCL5AG gene.

label: congenital hypothyroidism, DUOX2-related, pig
definition: Any congenital hypothyroidism in pigs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the DUOX2 gene.

label: bleeding disorder P2RY12-related, dog
definition: Hereditary thrombopathia associated with a defect in the ADP receptor P2Y12 in dogs due to a variation in the P2Y12 gene.

label: methemoglobinemia, CYB5R3-related, dog
definition: Any methemoglobinemia in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CYB5R3 gene.

label: methemoglobinemia, CYB5R3-related, domestic cat
definition: Any methemoglobinemia in cats in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CYB5R3 gene.

label: thrombopathia, RASGRP2-related, dog
definition: Any thrombopathia in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the RASGRP2 gene.

label: thrombopathia, RASGRP2-related, cattle
definition: Any thrombopathia in cattle in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the RASGRP2 gene.

label: maple syrup urine disease, BCKDHA-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary progressive neurological disease, resulting in death within a few days of birth due to a deficiency of activity of the mitochondrial enzyme branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase (BCKADH) leading to elevated concentrations of branched chain alpha-keto acids and their precursors, the branched chain amino acids, valine, leucine and isoleucine in blood and tissues in cattle due to a variation in the BCKDHA gene.

label: X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency disease, IL2RG-related, golden hamster
definition: Any severe combined immunodeficiency disease in golden hamsters in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IL2RG gene.

label: X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency disease, IL2RG-related, dog
definition: Any severe combined immunodeficiency disease in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IL2RG gene.

label: X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency disease, IL2RG-related, pig
definition: Any severe combined immunodeficiency disease in pigs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IL2RG gene.

label: severe combined immunodeficiency disease, RAG1-related, dog
definition: Any severe combined immunodeficiency disease in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the RAG1 gene.

label: severe combined immunodeficiency disease, pig
definition: This disorder was engineered via the TALEN technology to create mutations in the RAG1 and/or RAG2 genes for the purpose of establishing a porcine model of SCID.

label: immunodeficiency IL17RA-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary severe ulcerative dermatitis, growth restriction and increased infectious disease susceptibility in cattle due to a variation in the IL17RA gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, dermatosparaxis type, ADAMTS2-related, dog
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ADAMTS2 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, dermatosparaxis type, ADAMTS2-related, domestic cat
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in domestic cats in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ADAMTS2 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, dermatosparaxis type, ADAMTS2-related, cattle
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in cattle in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ADAMTS2 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, dermatosparaxis type, ADAMTS2-related, sheep
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in sheep in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ADAMTS2 gene.

label: X-linked hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, EDA-related, dog
definition: Hereditary sparse hair and dental aplasia in dogs associated with a variation in the EDA gene.

label: X-linked hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, EDA-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary sparse hair and dental aplasia in cattle associated with a variation in the EDA gene.

label: ichthyosis TGM1-related, dog
definition: Hereditary severe hyperkeratosis in dogs due to a variation in the TGM1 gene.

label: ichthyosis SLC27A4-related, dog
definition: Hereditary generalized severe hyperkeratosis with a formation of a strongly wrinkled, thickened and scaling skin in dogs due to a variation in the SLC27A4 gene.

label: ichthyosis NIPAL4-related, dog
definition: Hereditary hyperkeratosis characterized by generalized scaling in dogs due to a variation in the NIPAL4 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, kyphoscoliotic type, PLOD1-related, horse
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in horses in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the PLOD1 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, classic type, COL5A1-related, dog
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the COL5A1 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, classic type, COL5A1-related, domestic cat
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in domestic cats in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the COL5A1 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, classic-like, TNXB-related, dog
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the TNXB gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, classic type, COL5A2-related, dog
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the COL5A2 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, classic type, COL5A2-related, cattle
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome in cattle in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the COL5A2 gene.

label: muscular hypertrophy, MSTN-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary abnormal increase in muscular tissue caused by enlargement of existing cells in cattle due to a variation in the MSTN gene.

label: congenital increased muscular tonus, MYBPC1-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary weakness, stiffness, trembling in cattle in which the cause of the disease in a variation in the MYBPC1 gene.

label: nemaline myopathy, NEB-related, dog
definition: Hereditary generalized muscle atrophy characterized by the histological presence of rod-like inclusion bodies in skeletal muscle fibers in dogs due a variation in the NEB gene.

label: colorectal cancer, MLH1-related, Rhesus monkey
definition: Hereditary nonpolyposis colonic adenocarcinoma in Rhesus monkey due to a variation in the MLH1 gene.

label: spinocerebellar ataxia, CAPN1-related, dog
definition: Hereditary late onset progressive symmetric ataxia, truncal sway, pelvic limb hypermetria, and impaired balance in dogs due to a variation in the CAPN1 gene.

label: sensory neuropathy, RETREG1-related, dog
definition: Hereditary neurodegenerative disease affecting peripheral sensory and autonomic neurons in dogs due to a variation in the RETREG1 gene.

label: hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy, SCN9A-related, dog
definition: Congenital insensitivity to pain (CIP) in dogs due to a variation in the SCN9A gene.

label: coat color dilution, MLPH-related, dog
definition: Hereditary predisposition to color dilution alopecia in dogs due to a variation in the MLPH gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, OCA2-related, Mexican tetra
definition: Hereditary lack of melanin pigmentation in Mexican tetra due to a variation in the OCA2 gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, OCA2-related, dog
definition: Hereditary lightly pigmented coat, lips and nose and blue eyes in dogs due to a variation in the OCA2 gene.

label: nephropathy, COL4A4-related, dog
definition: Any nephropathy in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the COL4A4 gene.

label: hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, KISS1-related, pig
definition: Delayed or abolished puberty in male pigs due to a variation in the KISS1 gene.

label: primary ciliary dyskinesia CCDC39-related, dog
definition: Any primary ciliary dyskinesia in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CCDC39 gene.

label: osteogenesis imperfecta SERPINH1-related, dog
definition: Any osteogenesis imperfecta in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the SERPINH1 gene.

label: chondrodysplasia FGFR3-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary chondrodysplasia in cattle associated with a variation in the FGFR3 gene.

label: chondrodysplasia FGFR3-related, sheep
definition: Hereditary chondrodysplasia characterized by severe skeletal abnormalities in sheep due to a variation in the FGFR3 gene.

label: early onset cataract HSF4-related, dog
definition: Hereditary progressive, bilateral lens opacity affecting dogs within the first few months of life due to a mutation in the HSF4 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, TTC8-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy in dogs in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the TTC8 gene.

label: retinopathy, RDH5-related, domestic cat
definition: Hereditary marked delay in recovery of dark adaptation and degeneration of the area centralis (equivalent to the human macula) in cats due to a variation in the RDH5 gene.

label: X-linked disease, non-human animal
definition: X-linked disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia, non-human animal
definition: Hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia that occurs in non-human animals.

label: neurocristopathy, CHD7-related, cattle
definition: Any neurocristopathy in cattle in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CHD7 gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, non-human animal
definition: A group of inherited disorders of melanin synthesis, characterized by hypopigmentation of skin, hair and eyes.

label: mosaic SMO syndrome
definition: A somatic mosaic condition caused by a postzygotic mutation (c.1234 C>T p.Leu412Phe) in the SMO gene. Two overlapping clinical syndromes associated with this variant in SMO have been reported; Curry-Jones Syndrome (MIM:601707) and Happle-Tinschert Syndrome. The syndrome is characterized by cutaneous and skeletal manifestations such as linear hypo‐ or hyperpigmented lesions, basaloid follicular hamartomas, palmoplantar pitting, atrophoderma, hypertrichosis, polydactyly or syndactyly, rib anomalies (rudimentary ribs), and limb‐length anomalies. Craniofacial and dental abnormalities such as dysmorphic facies, macrocephaly, craniosynostosis, jaw tumors (ameloblastoma) have also been reported. Additional abnormalities impacting the gastrointestinal, cerebral, ophthalmic, and gonadal organs should also be considered. Some of these features include anal anomaly, colonic adenocarcinoma, severe constipation, myelofibrosis and smooth muscle hamartomas, malrotation, medulloblastoma, cerebral malformations, developmental delay, cataract, microphthalmia, coloboma, glaucoma, and cryptorchidism.

label: Happle-Tinschert syndrome
definition: Happle-Tinschert syndrome (HTS) is a rare, sporadic, multisystem disorder characterized by hypo- and hyperpigmented skin patches following Blaschko's lines, plus acral skeletal and other abnormalities and is characterized by basaloid follicular hamartomas. HTS is caused by a postzygotic mutation in the SMO gene (c.1234C>T, p.Leu412Phe).

label: hypermobility spectrum disorder
definition: An array of connective tissue disorders characterized by joint instability and chronic pain. Fatigue and other systemic symptoms that affect daily function may occur as well. These diseases are scored using the Beighton scoring system and one of more secondary musculoskeletal manifestations including post-traumatic symptoms, pain, altered proprioception, and a variety of other characteristics like pes planus, kyphosis, scoliosis, or joint misalignment.

label: sycosis barbae
definition: Folliculitis of the beard and/or mustache areas caused by a bacterial infection, usually caused by Staphylococcus aureus.
